item.title: Find Labs - Pioneering the Future of Web 3 with Purposeful Innovation
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Over the past year, the team atÂ .find has experienced consistent growth. Our commitment to innovation, coupled with successful product launches and collaborations with esteemed teams, has propelled us to expand our horizons. As a result, we are thrilled to announce our rebranding fromÂ .find to Find Labs. In this article, we will highlight our journey and outline our vision as we forge ahead in the dynamic realm of WebÂ 3.

Introduction:

The genesis of theÂ .find team can be traced back to two visionary individuals who crossed paths during the crypto craze of 2021. Drawing from their extensive backrounds and driven by their desire to innovate, Bjarte and Christian joined forces to establishÂ .find, a groundbreaking wallet naming service on the Flow Blockchain. However, this was merely the starting point of our extraordinary voyage.

With a dedication to innovation and a mission to provide functional tools for the Flow blockchain ecosystem, we have spent close to two years building and developing projects that improve the lives of users utilizing Flow blockchain. Today, we stand proud, as a significant transformation occurs asÂ .find transitions to Find Labs, signifying our commitment to constant evolution and progress.

.findâ€Šâ€”â€ŠFlowâ€™s Wallet Naming Platform:

In the early days of Flow Blockchain, as projects and services proliferated, a sense of fragmentation permeated the ecosystem. There was a pressing need for a comprehensive solution that would unify and streamline the management of digital assets. In response, find.xyz emerged as a pioneering platform, resolving these challenges by allowing users to link multiple wallets to a singleÂ .find name and quickly locate all their assets in oneÂ place.

Our team united under a shared purpose: to empower individuals to effortlessly locate what they seek within the Flow ecosystem. Through determination and ingenuity, we crafted a platform that revolutionized the user experience and fostered a sense of cohesion within the blockchain landscape. This project is near and dear to our hearts, and will be built upon in the years toÂ come.

Some of our notable Collaborations:

Over the past two years, we have also forged invaluable collaborations and partnerships with esteemed teams such as Doodles and OneFootball. These partnerships have not only enriched our journey but have also enabled us to deliver exceptional solutions and bring our clientsâ€™ visions to life in Web 3. We look forward to future collaborations, working hand in hand with diverse clients to navigate the ever-evolving landscape of decentralized technologies.

A Vision for theÂ Future:

As Find Labs, our vision is clear: to be at the forefront of the Web 3 revolution by crafting innovative solutions that empower users, developers, and enterprises within the decentralized realm. Building upon our expertise in wallet naming services, we are committed to expanding our product offerings and delivering an array of tools and services that enhance the Flow blockchain experience. Our next big project, is an extensive block explorer, get ready to deep diveÂ #onFlow.

Conclusion:

The rebranding fromÂ .find to Find Labs marks an extraordinary juncture in our trajectory, underscoring our relentless pursuit of innovation and growth. From our humble origins as a wallet naming service, we have embraced a broader vision that encompasses pioneering ventures such as our latest project, a block explorer specific for Flow blockchain. We extend our deepest gratitude to our community, partners, and supporters, who have been instrumental in our journey thusÂ far.

Welcome to Find Labs, where we embark on a journey fueled by purposeful innovation. Join us as we shape the future of Web 3, empower individuals, and redefine the possibilities of decentralized technologies. Together, let us forge a path towards a more connected, inclusive, and transformative digital landscape.

The best is yet toÂ come.

item.title: Afterfutureâ€Šâ€”â€ŠArtist Spotlightâ€Šâ€”â€ŠNew Drop coming soon! #onFlow
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Afterfutureâ€Šâ€”â€ŠArtist Spotlightâ€Šâ€”â€ŠNew Drop coming soon!Â #onFlow

With Afterfuture dropping their next big art release on the Flow Blockchain, we atÂ .find wanted to get the inside scoop for collectors before the release. Enjoy this Q&A from the Afterfuture team.

To kick things off, can you tell us a bit about yourself and your background as an artist?
My name is Angel, and Iâ€™m the co-founder of Afterfuture. I started back in 2016 creating 3D stuff just for fun and saw the boom on Instagram that was happening back then, so I jumped on the wagon and started creating pieces every single day from early 2017 to lateÂ 2018.

What inspired you to create an NFT collection?
Specifically for Generated Experiences, it was a random idea that I thought sounded cool, like having an actual research facility named GENXP and the researchers simulating different artifacts in a strange old-looking machine that is futuristic at the sameÂ time.

How did you approach the creative process for this particular collection?
I started with the trailer first, which took quite some time to finish, and then the video loops, which is kind of weird, but I thought thatâ€™d speed up my process and making the still artworks would be the easier part, which definitely helped me a lot in the process. I started thinking about the rarities as well as the direction weâ€™re going in because the story was pretty rough at theÂ time.

(Currently, this platform doesnâ€™t supportÂ .mov files, so be sure to check out on socialÂ media)

Can you walk us through some of the themes and motifs that are present in your NFT artwork?
We love creating pieces that are linked to nature and technology, working hand in hand. Itâ€™s always been our idea to create this harmony between those 2 completely different realities yet theyâ€™re inÂ sync.

How do you see the intersection of art and technology evolving in the future?
Canâ€™t say much about that because art and technology are evolving every single day, softwares are getting some incredible quality of life updates, technology is improving like no tomorrow, so itâ€™s pretty easy to start creating artÂ today.

What advice would you give to other artists who are interested in creating NFTs?
Just go for it, it never hurts to try out another space the same way we did, we came back in late 2020 and ended up loving it. Build slowly, interact with the community youâ€™re going to be part of, reward the people supporting you, and things willÂ happen.

Can you tell us about any upcoming projects or collaborations that youâ€™re excited about?
I havenâ€™t been around that much lately because of the amount of work weâ€™ve been doing for Generated Experiences and other projects, but the 2 projects that Iâ€™m always excited to see expand areÂ .find and Flovatar.

How do you think NFTs will impact the art world in the long term?
I think that NFTs have impacted the art world like no other wave before that, giving artists their freedom, the blockchain footprint of their work and royalties. I think it will help artists in the future to expand their brand, vision and maybe try some new ventures.

Finally, where can collectors go to view and purchase your NFT collection on our marketplace?
Weâ€™ve been on Flow for quite some time at this point, so collectors can explore our pieces and their stories at Versus, Starly, xtingles and very soonÂ .find.

There you have it, some insight into the creators of the Generated Experiences collection, dropping onÂ .find this Friday, 12-May! These are artists who have promoted and build #onFlow since the beginning.

You canÂ .find more details on the official drop page here: https://find.xyz/afterfuture/pack/1

Roadmap: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Afterfuture:

Drop Page: https://find.xyz/afterfuture/pack/1
Twitter: https://twitter.com/afterfuture_nft

item.title: How to send Doodles 2 Wearables to Non-Custodial Wallets: A Guide byÂ .find
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
How to send Doodles 2 Wearables to Non-Custodial Wallets: A Guide byÂ .find

Looking for a hassle-free way to move your Doodles 2 Wearables to a non-Custodial wallet? This blog post is forÂ you.

Overview:

If youâ€™re looking for a hassle-free way to move your Doodles 2 Wearables to non-Dapper wallets, youâ€™ve come to the right place. TheÂ .find team have created a feature to move your wearables between ALL wallets, both custodial and non-custodial. Follow these steps to move your Wearables quickly andÂ easily:

Follow the steps below to move your wearables from Dapper to non-Dapper wallets quickly andÂ easily.

Condensed version ofÂ steps:

  1. Create a non-Dapper wallet
  2. Setup yourÂ .findÂ profile
  3. UtilizeÂ .findâ€™s sendÂ feature
  4. Thatâ€™s it.

For more details, keepÂ reading.

1. Create Non-Dapper Wallet:

If you donâ€™t have a non-Dapper wallet yet, choose one that best suits your needs from options such as NuFi, Lilico, Flipper, or Blocto. Once youâ€™ve created your wallet, you will need to activate the wearables collection to receive Wearables on the Flow Blockchain.

There are a handful of options to choose from and each have their merits: NuFi, Lilico, Flipper, & Blocto (& possibly others by the time you readÂ this).

Step 2: Setup yourÂ .findÂ profile

Navigate to theÂ .find website and activate the wearables contract. After logging in with your non-Dapper wallet, set up your new account and click â€œTrain Meâ€ on your dashboard to prepare your wallet to receive Wearables. Be sure to have $Flow in your wallet to cover the gas fees for these transactions.

If this is your first time logging in with a new wallet, you will be guided through a streamlined profile activation phase. This does incur a small gas fee, so be sure to have some $Flow in yourÂ wallet.

Your wallet is now ready to receive Wearables!

Step 3: Login with your DapperÂ Wallet

Log in with your Dapper wallet and navigate to the NFT Detail Page under the COLLECTIONS tab on your dashboard. Select the Wearable you wish to move, click â€œSEND,â€ enter your address orÂ .find name, and confirm the transaction.

Note: Sending Wearables via theÂ .find platform is simple and easy. Attempting to send them through Dapper wallet UI will prompt additional steps.

Ready toÂ Go!

Thatâ€™s it! Your Doodles 2 Wearables will be transferred from your Dapper wallet to the non-Dapper wallet address you specified. Be sure to double-check the destination address before confirming the transfer to avoid any mistakes. You can useÂ .find names to simplify the address and make it more human-readable. If you have any further questions, please feel free to reach out to us through our Discord or social media channels. Happy transacting!

UsingÂ .find names can be advantageous as they offer an easy-to-remember name for complex 0xâ€¦ addresses. Moreover,Â .find names work seamlessly on various platforms within the Flow Ecosystem, making the transfer process even more streamlined as well as sharing your collection withÂ friends.

We hope you enjoyed this short informative posts, if you have further questions feel free to reach out to us in our Discord or on social media, linksÂ below.

Have a DoodleyÂ day!

Some CommonÂ Issues:

  • Not having enough Flowâ€Šâ€”â€ŠWhile transaction are really cheap #onFlow, you will need some Flow to setup your accounts. Additionally, Flow wallets can run out of storage if they donâ€™t contain enough Flow tokens. So consider seeding your new wallet with at least 5 Flow to never worryÂ again!
  • Not actuating firstâ€Šâ€”â€ŠIf you try and send the wearables to your non-dapper wallet, before actuating the Wearables contract, the transaction willÂ fail!
  • Using Dapper UIâ€Šâ€”â€Šif you try sending wearables via the Dapper UI, instead of using theÂ .find platform, you might run into additional steps that could slow down theÂ process.
Consider storing 5 Flow in your wallet to never worry about transaction fees or storageÂ issues.

Helpful Links:

Website: https://find.xyz
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Roadmap: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

item.title: The DoodlesÂ .find their Flow
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
The DoodlesÂ .find theirÂ Flow

The Doodles team has launched Doodles 2 on the Flow Blockchain, which is rather exciting for current and future Flow enthusiasts! Here, we discuss Findâ€™s role in assisting with this expansion from Ethereum to Flow, take a closer look at what we do, and examine some of the awesome new features we are implementing.

Overview

Creativity and innovation are key players in the world of NFTs. One specific project has been making waves in the industry, Doodles. Known for its unique approach to NFTs, Doodles are now taking a big step, in the right direction, by expanding onto the Flow blockchain with DoodlesÂ 2.

Excitingly, the backend expansion of Doodles 2 is being handled by us here atÂ .find.

Going with the FlowÂ ğŸŒŠ

While Ethereum was an excellent theatre for stage one, the Doodles team had found themselves constrained by challenges such as network congestion, high gas prices and complex onboarding experience.

The wizards at Doodles, who are constantly seeking to expand their creative and technological cauldrons, needed the space and freedom to do so. They selected the Flow blockchain for their expansion to Doodles 2 because of the interoperability of Flow across various platforms, including social media, events, gaming, and streaming. Working withÂ .find has enabled Doodles to build a robust architecture on Flow that will scale on demand. The Doodles community, and those new to the fun, can look forward to easy onboarding, frictionless interactions and checkout experiences when exploring the delights of DoodlesÂ 2.

Securityâ€Šâ€”â€ŠUsers will also enjoy the enhanced safety and security benefits of Cadence, Flowâ€™s unique resource-oriented programming language.

.find out what we built forÂ Doodles

If you, like us, relish in a little more detail, here are the highlights of whatÂ .find actually built forÂ Doodles:

  • Core Flow contracts. We have been working with Doodles and their partners to create, test, and refine their NFT, admin and wearables contracts. To achieve this we used the new default implementation in interfaces feature in Flow to create some really nice new patterns in Cadence, which in turn offered new and bespoke functions within the Doodles contracts.
  • Trusted Ethereum to Flow bridgeâ€Šâ€”â€Šthe Dooplicator As the name suggests, the Dooplicator we built is a verified trusted bridge to securely and seamlessly Dooplicate the Doodles from Ethereum to Flow. Owners will be able to create and link a Flow account to their Ethereum wallet, where they hold their Doodle or have purchased the rights to Dooplicate a Doodle and receive an airdrop of their Doodle 2 and wearables.
  • .find Doodles Marketplace. We couldnâ€™t pass up the opportunity to create a wonderful marketplace to buy and sell all your Doodles 2 assets on Flow. So we have created a Doodles themed marketplace with Dapper wallet andÂ .find name integration especially for your enjoyment.

Check it out here: https://find.xyz/mp/Wearables

Why you shouldÂ .findÂ us

  1. We build kick-ass software!
  2. We work fast and efficiently
  3. Weâ€™re awesome to work with (askÂ around!)

We atÂ .find donâ€™t just have epic pun skills, we have deep roots at the heart of the Flow community. Self-funded, and voraciously driven, we are working independently to support and advise Flow and projects working on Flow, while also building infrastructure and products to expand the ecosystem.

Recent work atÂ .find:

  • Worked on the official NFT metadata standard forÂ Flow
  • Created theÂ .find name system for human readable domains onÂ Flow
  • Built a fully featured marketplace for NFTs andÂ .findÂ names
  • Built the Aera Onefootball backend architecture
  • Built the Doodles 2 backend architecture
  • Integrated with both Dapper and non-Dapper wallets (Blocto, Lilico,Â etc.)

New features forÂ .find

With the Doodles expansion, we took it upon ourselves to release some exciting new features.

  • We have just integrated buy/sell and linkÂ .find names with DapperÂ Wallet
  • You can now buy and sell NFTs with DapperÂ wallet
  • You can link multiple wallets to your find profile, both Dapper and Non-Dapper (Blocto, Lilico,Â etc.)
  • Buy and sell in both USD andÂ FLOW

This is a great step forward to have integration for both Dapper and non-Dapper wallets, in turn we will only show the NFTs relevant to your logged inÂ wallet.

  • Our Launchpad is now ready, you can apply here to launch your project onÂ .find
  • NFT indexer, created to catch the current status and historical movements of all NFTs onÂ Flow

.find out whatâ€™s in ourÂ pipeline

  • We have a completely redesigned marketplaceâ€Šâ€”â€ŠcomingÂ soon.
  • We have been building the tooling required to unify Flow NFT projects into a single unified marketplace across the various wallet types, much has been done but there is more toÂ come.
  • On-chain blog posts and messaging
  • Floor sweep / bull buyÂ features
  • We continue to enable companies and projects to innovate.
If you would like to work with us reach out through the channelsÂ below

Links and Resources:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all linksÂ below).

.find:

Website: https://find.xyz
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Roadmap: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Doodles

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: Extending aÂ .find Name
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Extending aÂ .findÂ Name

This is a short informative article forÂ .find users searching for a descriptive guide on extending theirÂ .find Names on our platform.

Overview

.find names are leased out on a yearly basis, meaning, for a small yearly fee users get access to domains adding real world value to their wallet addresses. Since we opened last year, our platform has grown at an impressive rate, adding more capabilities and features, and the first names have begun toÂ expire.

Users have 3-months to renew their names, after the three months, the names will be released to the public allowing other users to claimÂ them.

No fret though, extending your favoriteÂ .find names is an easy process and will be explained here!

Step byÂ Step:

Step 1 - Login withÂ Blocto:

First is self-explanatory, navigate to theÂ .find website and login with your Blocto wallet, soon users will also be able to create a profile using their Dapper Wallet (Exciting!) but for now utiliseÂ Blocto.

Step 2â€Šâ€”â€ŠNavigate to your Dashboard

The user Dashboard hosts a lot of helpful information, so feel free to spend some time in this area to see all the helpful featuresÂ .find has toÂ offer!

Desktop: This is found on the left hand sideâ€Šâ€”â€Šwhen you hover your mouse over the left panel, it will pop-out and you can then click (Dashboard).

Mobile: After logging in, you might find yourself already on the dashboard page, if not, click the hamburger menu on the top right and select (Dashboard).

Step 3â€Šâ€”â€Šfind and select the (Names)Â Tab

Next you will need to navigate to the NAMES tab. This tab will show you all your owned names. There are helpful tags next to some Names showing if they are expired and need to be extended.

Desktop: You will easily see the name tab on the
Mobile: Scroll down and find the Names tab and select thisÂ tab

Step 4â€Šâ€”â€ŠOpen the Dropdown and ClickÂ (Extend)

Desktop: On Desktop, once you get to the Names page, you will see a button called (Manage). When you select this button, you will be presented with a drop down menu with a couple different actions. Simply click, (Extend), and run that transaction.

Mobile: If you are on a mobile device, you wonâ€™t see the word (Manage), you will be presented with an arrow for you to select. This arrow will create the drop down menu for you to select (Extend).

Step 5â€Šâ€”â€ŠCompletion: Leave us aÂ Thought!

After the transaction is successful, your name will be extended and you can keep using the platform and enjoying all the amazing features on ourÂ webpage.

So take the time to leave us a comment via our on-chain â€œThoughtsâ€ channel and browse the Marketplace.

Questions:

If you have any questions feel free to reach out to us on our Discord channel and one of our staff members will handle it in a timelyÂ manner!

Thanks forÂ Reading!

Helpful Links:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all linksÂ below).

Website: https://find.xyz/lf/thoughts
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Emerald ID: https://id.ecdao.org/

Author:

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: Enjoy Flow NFTs, all in one placeâ€Šâ€”â€Š.find links with Emerald DAO
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy Flow NFTs, all in one placeâ€Šâ€”â€Š.find links with EmeraldÂ DAO

TheÂ .find platform has established a link with the Emerald DAO to provide more content to users of theÂ .find platform.

Overview

When it comes to owning NFTs, viewing your entire collection is one of the many joys within the Web3 space. This was often time consuming and confusing on Flow Blockchain because collections were often spread out between different wallets and platforms. No longer is that the case now thatÂ .find has implemented a link with the EmeraldÂ City.

Now, users only have to complete two simple steps to have access to majority of the NFTs on Flow Blockchain.

View Lillico, Blocto, and Dapper NFTs all in oneÂ place.

.find Platform

TheÂ .find platform already allowed users the ability to sign-in and link their Blocto wallets to their profile, this new integration now opens the door to easily view both Dapper and Lillico NFTs as well as Blocto NFTs. Exciting times to view all your NFTs in oneÂ place.

This integration allows for viewing of your entire collection, but only Blocto NFTs can be traded. We are in the process of fully integrating the Dapper Wallet, allowing users the ability to trade Dapper NFTs so keep a look out for that announcement!

The EmeraldÂ ID

The Emerald ID is an impressive system built by the Emerald DAO team. It has been around for a couple months allowing users the ability to link certain Flow wallets to a distinct DiscordÂ handle.

By linking users wallets to their Discord handle, users are able to easily verify NFT ownership when bouncing between DiscordÂ servers.

Currently, the Emerald ID supports three different wallets: Lillico, Blocto, and Dapper wallets. If you have one or more of these wallets, you can link them to your Emerald ID and yourÂ .find profile will automatically update if you are a currentÂ .findÂ user.

Easy Setup:

The integration is possible in two easyÂ steps:

  • Step One: Create aÂ .find profile hereâ€Šâ€”â€Šwww.find.xyz
  • Step Two: Create and link all your wallets to a Emerald DAO account here: https://id.ecdao.org/
  • Note: If you already have aÂ .find profile and Emerald ID, then your account is already good-to-go! You can begin enjoying all yourÂ NFTs

No Discord?

Currently, the Emerald ID works by linking your wallets to a distinct Discord handle. Understanding not all users utilise Discord,Â .find is in the process of enabling our own wallet linkage system for users who donâ€™t want the required Discord portion of Emerald ID. So stayÂ tuned!

Conclusion

We atÂ .find are constantly moving forward with empowering users and always open to collaborating with other builders. The ability to work with Emerald DAO on this collaborative piece has opened doors for new users to enjoy their Flow NFT collections.

So what are you waiting for? GoÂ .find something new and donâ€™t forget to tag us on social media! We want to see what you are lookingÂ at.

Helpful Links:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all linksÂ below).

Website: https://find.xyz/lf/thoughts
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Emerald ID: https://id.ecdao.org/

Author:

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: â€œThoughtsâ€â€Šâ€”â€Šan On-Chain Messaging system built for Flow Blockchain
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
â€œThoughtsâ€â€Šâ€”â€Šan On-Chain Messaging system built for Flow Blockchain

The ability to share ideas is one of the many characteristics that separates us from other mammals. We atÂ .find are enabling users to permanently share their ideas and thoughts on the Flow Blockchain via our new Messaging platform.

The BigÂ Idea:

We humans are social creatures, we enjoy sharing interesting thoughts, simple gestures, and wacky jokes with our friends and community members. These expressions showcase our fluctuating moods and unique characters. AtÂ .find, we want to allow users the ability to etch their ideas in a virtual stoneÂ wall.

As the famous line goes, â€œI think, therefore IÂ amâ€.

An OnlineÂ Persona

AtÂ .find, we strive to support our users in expressing their individuality through a myriad of ways. From custom profiles, to unique wallet names, to solidifying their â€œthoughtsâ€ on the Flow Blockchain; we strive to empower our users in all aspects of their digital identity.

And this is only the beginning. Our first iteration of this platform allows users to post permanent content to the â€œlive-feedâ€, via one simple and fast transaction.

Version 1.0: â€œThoughts Launch onÂ .findâ€

With the current build, usersÂ can:

  • Post permanent â€œThoughtsâ€ directly to the live-feed using a Blocto Wallet (subsidised gas fees viaÂ Blocto).
  • React to other user â€œThoughtsâ€ using different emojis.

Our Roadmap for this FeatureÂ set:

With the first iteration built and live, our developers are quickly coming up with new ways to interact with this newÂ feature.

Planned features for the â€œThoughtsâ€ Platform:

  • Allow users to edit theirÂ posts
  • Delete â€œThoughtsâ€
  • Add images; link NFTs to their â€œThoughtsâ€
  • Reply to otherÂ .find users â€œThoughtsâ€
  • Send Direct Messages to otherÂ .findÂ users
  • Mint their thoughts as actualÂ NFTs

Conclusion:

This is merely the beginning of the road for this new communicative platform, and we look forward to working with users as we continually build our â€œThoughtsâ€ platform. Each human is unique and their thoughts and ideas make them a valued member of our community.

So I leave you with this question: â€œWhat will your first thoughtÂ be?â€

Helpful Links:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all linksÂ below).

Website: https://find.xyz/lf/thoughts
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow

Author:

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: One Year Anniversaryâ€Šâ€”â€ŠLoads of New Features from theÂ .Find Platform
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Year One Anniversaryâ€Šâ€”â€ŠFeature Releaseâ€Šâ€”â€Šfrom theÂ .FindÂ Platform

Over the past year,Â .Find has been diligently designing and building exciting new features for our evolving platform on the Flow Blockchain. Codenamed operation Flamingo, this set of new features brings a lot of excitement and utility toÂ .Find and Flow; this Post is an overview from the latest release on 13.12.22.

11 - New Features Overview:

  • Marketplace Tags
  • On-Chain â€œThoughtsâ€â€Šâ€”â€ŠvÂ 1.0
  • Upgraded Livefeed
  • User Reactions and Watchlist
  • New On-boarding Process
  • Flowty Integration
  • NFT Storefront Integration
  • Website VisualÂ Upgrades
  • Sending NFTÂ Upgrades
  • The Furnaceâ€Šâ€”â€ŠBurnÂ NFTs
  • Upgraded Visibility ofÂ Roadmap

Feature 1: Marketplace Tags:

Browsing your collection is one of the simple joys of owning NFTs and itâ€™s also fun to browse other wallets as well. Sometimes we stumble across inspiring art pieces while browsing other collections and we have made it easier to see if it is For Sale orÂ Auction.

We added indicators on the bottom left of NFTs quickly showing users which NFTs are listed on the marketplace and which oneâ€™s arenâ€™t making browsing an even more enjoyable experience.

Feature 2: On-Chain â€œThoughtsâ€ PostsÂ V1

Thoughts, are an exciting feature arriving to our platform! These â€œThoughtsâ€ are a fully on-chain, public messaging experience, allowing users the ability to write messages directly on the live-feed.

This is a truly exciting feature with more information to come! Look for its own Medium postÂ soon.

Feature 3: UpgradedÂ Livefeed

In a world that produces more data than any other resource, it can be quite overwhelming when trying to find what you are looking for,Â .Find wants to help with thatÂ dilemma.

Our custom Livefeed now offers users the ability to Filter their searches, narrowing down their searches to exactly what they are lookingÂ for.

Filter Options:

  • Latest Sales
  • Latest Listings
  • Mints
  • Thoughts
  • Burns
  • Trending (ComingÂ Soon)

Feature 4: User Reactions and Watchlists!

This addition adds multiple ways to interact with our website and the NFTs being showcased. From building a custom favorites list, to counting views, and reacting to other thoughts, the interactive possibilities are here onÂ .Find!

Favorites:

The favorites list is built using the (Heart) icon on-top of NFTs. Add a heart and that NFT is added to your Watch List, easy as that! This easy system allows you, the user, the ability to follow your favorite NFTs in the Flow Ecosystem!

  • Favorites List & Watchlist (SameÂ thing)
This list if found under the user store-front page on our website! Get out there and start filling it up with your FavoriteÂ NFTs!

Likes:

These are stored with the NFT and separate from the favorites list. Sometimes we like an NFT but wouldnâ€™t buy it, this is that feature!Â .

Views:

Every time a user views an item, the counter goes upâ€Šâ€”â€Šsimple but an interesting statistic to see what the community isÂ viewing.

Feature 5: New Onboarding Processâ€Šâ€”â€ŠProfile Enhancements

User profiles are how we showcase ourselves to the world, it is one of the standing hallmarks of PFP projects, interesting usernames, and personification of ourselves in the digitalÂ world.

Here atÂ .Find, we want to make that process easier and more enjoyable, so we updated our system to guide users through a new experience when setting up their profiles for the firstÂ time.

We have profile names, andÂ .Find names, more clarification will come on the twoÂ soon.

Profile Names: On-chain but not tied to the userÂ wallet.

.Find Names: On-chain resources giving users unique domain abilities within the Flow Ecosystem.

Feature 6â€Šâ€”â€ŠFlowty Integration

Flowty is an interesting tool allowing users to create NFT Loans and Rentals on the Flow Blockchain. Need a Top Shot moment for a specific challenge or a Flovatar just for the weekend? We atÂ .Find have made it easier to find what you are looking for with this integration.

Quickly see which NFTs are also listed on Flowty from the NFT DetailsÂ Page.

Feature 7Â : NFT Storefront Integration:

This feature shows NFTs are for sale using the NFT storefront contract from Flow. While your browsing otherâ€™s collections, you can now see who has items listed on outside marketplaces.

There are numerous sites out there using the NFT Storefront and we canâ€™t show exactly which Storefront the NFT is listed on, yet, but we are working on that issueÂ now!

Feature 8: Numerous Website VisualÂ Upgrades

While browsing the website, you will notice numerous upgrades across theÂ .Find site. These come together to make an overall more enjoyable user experience. These upgrades will continually be improved upon movingÂ forward.

New Font:Â Inter

Mobile Experience Upgrades: New Mobile Models have been added for the mobile view, swipe away toÂ close!

Feature 9: Sending NFTs? We made that easierÂ also!

We added multiple new addition providing users more abilities and feedback when sending NFTs across the Flow Ecosystem.

  • Wallet informationâ€Šâ€”â€ŠNot all Flow NFTs are compatible with all wallets, users will now have more information concerning the receiverâ€™s wallet allowing for more informed decisions.
  • Messagesâ€Šâ€”â€ŠYou can now add messages to sent NFTs, allowing the sender to leave funny comments, congratulate giveaway winners, or simply sayÂ Enjoy!
  • New user â€œInboxâ€ Featureâ€Šâ€”â€ŠFlow has a spam filter on wallets, rejecting NFTs from collections not established previously on the userâ€™s wallet. This sometimes prevents the user from receiving NFTs they might want, so we implemented theÂ Inbox.
  • Tip Jarâ€Šâ€”â€ŠSaving a buck is always a plus, we added a tip jar when sending NFTs offering you, the user to tip the creators and platforms when sending NFTs. This is not mandatory but we wanted to empower users with the ability to continually support the communities theyÂ enjoy.
NFTs sent to wallets without the corresponding collection will go to that users Inbox until claimed, and they donâ€™t want the NFT you sent, donâ€™t claim it, simple asÂ that!

Feature 10: The Furnaceâ€Šâ€”â€ŠBurn BabyÂ Burn!

We all have one or two NFTs that are no longer needed in the collection, now you can burn those unwanted pieces via ourÂ Furnace.

  • This feature allows users to destroy unwantedÂ NFTs
  • It also allows creators the ability to create interesting concepts with their projects, giving fun integrations between creator and collectors.
A development idea for creators: Burn one NFT and receive another, we are only scratching the surface on possibilities and believe this feature will come in handy in the years toÂ come!

Feature 11: Upgraded Roadmap Visibility

Interested to know what we are currently working on? Or have some fun ideas on what we can add next to our platform, let usÂ know!

  • On our Roadmap, you can see our tasks, report bug, leave comments, make suggestions, and keep updated all in oneÂ place.
  • Check it out here: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Summary:

This massive feature release is just the tip of the iceberg for our plans with building out theÂ .Find platform and the Flow Ecosystem. Our goal is to empower and connect users across Blockchains and with the Flow Ecosystem.

Collaboration:

AtÂ .Find, we are keen on collaborating with all projects currently building on Flow. From integrating our naming domain service, to being listed in our site, please reach out to us if you are interested in building out your platform for the greater good on Flow Blockchain.

Helpful Links:

Websites:

Find: https://find.xyz/

Flowty: https://www.flowty.io/

Flow Blockchain: https://flow.com/

Social Media:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow

Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow

item.title: .find Artist Showcase â€”Lapin Mignon
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
TheÂ .find team would like to feature a special guest artist who is creating a small exquisite collection of Artwork for theÂ .find platform.

Lapin Mignon has had an interesting career path, and has been in the NFT space since 2019, combining tangible pieces with digital accents. She has since created some beautiful art collections while building an engaged audience, with avid collectors, and theÂ .find team is excited to be working with her on this collaborative piece.

Gender neutrality is an important topic, and we found our current automated PFPs were boxing people in, we want to change this. Lapin will be creating 4 different, gender neutral comical characters, in her unique style, specifically forÂ .find.

Plus, the community will get to decide on the final characters that join the collectionâ€Šâ€”â€Šso keep a lookÂ out!

Below you can see some example images on what those might lookÂ like!

Our Interview Questions:

How would you describe your art style? And when did you start focusing on art as more than aÂ hobby?

I love describing my art as â€œAugmented Watercolourâ€. I am obsessed with using a large array of digital tools to enhance and augment my analog watercolour. The base artwork and the final artwork are miles away from each other. Augmented Reality, Dynamic NFT, Generative Art, Animationâ€Šâ€”â€ŠName it and Iâ€™ll deep dive into it with my paintings.

So have you always been anÂ artist?

Well, art has always been a big part of my life, but ever since 2019, I found my audience and Art family in cryptoArt. This passion motivates me to create more, and I love seeing the support from the community.

Then in 2021, my work-life balance started to become a challenge, especially with 2 young energetic boys. So in March 2022, I decided to make the jump to go mainly into NFTs, Cryptocurrencies, and NFT Advisory, while remaining an Art Advisor for Fanny Lakoubay in LALÂ Art.

So you did first found CryptoART inÂ 2019?

Yeah! I discovered CryptoART in 2019, in May to be precise; I was at a point in my life where Art was a hobby, but I wasnâ€™t finding my audience. I was exhibiting my watercolours locally, but had a fear of falling into the crafts niche segment, and not being taken serious for my artwork, my creations werenâ€™t crafts, they areÂ art.

Often, during holiday season, I was questioning my career as an established Marketing Executive, but was dreaming to one day break through with my Art. Often considering returning to Art School, having left 15 years ago to attend BusinessÂ Schoolâ€¦

Okay, so you wanted to make Art a full-time gig, but struggling to break through, what was the bigÂ change?

Looking for other options, I texted a dear friend, Fanny Lakoubay for advice, as she did remote classes about Art. She replied with a link and a supportive message. â€œTry Editional App, and have fun with the communityâ€. That was game changing for me. She briefly explained that instead of posting my artwork simply on social media, I could protect it by minting it on the Blockchain.

Back then, we were a small bunch of artists, most of us wondering what was happening, and we were minting and exchanging Art for free on the ETH blockchain (How crazy is that!). The rest is sinceÂ History.

Okay, letâ€™s circle back around to your art creation because you have a rather distinct style of mixing tangible drawings with digital media. Why isÂ that?

Yeah! Since a very young age, I love crafting with everything around me. From the nature to paints, including rocks, leaves, clay, sand, shells, paper cuts, wool, wood, etcâ€¦ My friends say Iâ€™m like Lavoisier, â€œ Nothing is lost, nothing is created, everything is transformedâ€ and ever since I keep on creating from bits andÂ pieces.

So the relationship with materiality, feel the paper, the water, is essential for me. I tried many times to draw on my tablet, with special pens, special textured screenâ€Šâ€”â€Šand I never felt any connection with itâ€Šâ€”â€ŠI can draw, but the emotion of creating is not there, and as a kid, I need to enjoy theÂ moment.

Woah that is really great to hear, I feel we are losing some of artistic styles as the world moves to a more digital setting. Iâ€™m happy you are keeping these mediumsÂ alive!

Also, I am a strong believer that computers and software tend to frame and influence how we work, as an Executive, I would take breaks from the laptop when I needed to be creative. To me, creativity comes alive with pen and paper. I have hundreds of notebooks, filled with creative ideas that might never have existed if I stayed in front of a digitalÂ screen.

Sounds logical but I can assure you that very few in the office space takes enough break from screensâ€Šâ€”â€Šand letâ€™s think about itâ€Šâ€”â€ŠIdeating around a powerpoint will force you to create a bullet point list or a diagramâ€Šâ€”â€Šhere we are Formatisation; and it is just anÂ example.

I have to agree, we do so much of our work with a screen, I feel it takes away some of the experience of creation as the computer fills in some of the dots. I recently picked up a sketch book again after drawing solely with Procreate over the last year. What do you enjoyÂ using?

So I always start on paper, using a very thick 300g/m2 source from Canson, made for watercolours. Then I simply start drawing, sometimes Iâ€™ll mentally create a theme before drawing, and sometimes I dive in without a clear ideaâ€Šâ€”â€Šjust creating. Letting that uncontainable urge to hit the paper, to me feeling is essential, and I become a drawing machine letting my mind wander around theÂ ink.

So my process is sketches with pencil, line art with pens, and then finally waatercolours.

So you created a tangible piece of art, but you like to add more digital aspectsÂ correct?

Correct, that is the base, the Analogue Art, which for most traditional artists or illustrators would be enoughâ€¦ But as mentioned I am obsessed on how to augment it, so begins the process of scanning, having created a montage on my desk to create a good quality scans, then using a a multitude of digital tools like Polarr to play with the colours, and Procreate to finalise details, animate,Â etc.

That is really exciting stuff! You enjoy collaboration as well, and moving toward DigitalÂ AI?

And I usually play with platforms once I minted it, as an NFT, like AsyncArt where I play with the Dynamic Aspect for my NFT with a Night and Day version of the same cryptoArt! and since I am now working a lot with Tagachi (who is this? Link to their work), ideas are flourishing.

Letâ€™s move toward your collaboration withÂ .find, how did you two meet? Since we are built on Flow and you are primarily on Ethereum.

They found meâ€Šâ€”â€ŠWerekitty (discord handle) is one of my most supportive collectorsâ€Šâ€”â€Šand I am forever grateful to her as she has supported my Art from the beginning. Collectors like that are so precious.

Then in 2022, I made a talk at NFC Lisbon about CryptoArt History and finally met Bjartek. That was quite emotional. I wish to one day meet his wife, (Werekitty). At that time, there was no mention ofÂ .find and in August, and I had to postpone further the launch of Mignonverse, another project of mine, because of the Bear Market. So I sent a tweet asking if anyone wanted to have an advisor for their project or platform, so that I had a little bit more time for the next few months. And Christian and Bjartek contacted me and I was in love with the idea ofÂ .findâ€Šâ€”â€Šhere IÂ am!

And we are happy to have you here Lapin! Thank you for sharing your amazing story with us and Iâ€™m excited to see where this collaboration goes as we move forward. Also, Iâ€™m interested to see the options people will have to vote on for the PFP images you are creating specifically forÂ .find!

Find Website: https://find.xyz/
Lapin Mignon Website: https://www.lapinmignon.co.uk/
